body: The standard way includes using an InputStream with some REST protocols.  The Google HTTP Client can help some.  You might check StackOverflow for some references.

As you can see [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backends-gwt/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/gwt/emu/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/Pixmap.java), `Pixmap` on GWT has constructors which take libGDX's `FileHandle` (which could work for what you need) or HTML `ImageElement`. I haven't worked with it personally, but it seems that it should be possible to create an HTML `<image>` and load it from that.

As this isn't really a libGDX issue, please close it and check [Discord or IRC](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Getting-Help).

Regarding the warning: I have never seen it, but it looks like Java's `Preferences` are for some reason trying to write into Windows registry. I don't know why would it do that. You will probably have to investigate that yourself, or, again, check Discord/IRC.

GWT / HTML could probably use some extra methods for simplicity's sake that help this.  Other wise, I am not using GWT at the moment.  I would add it my self if so.  My focus remains on Android, until Firebase and Google Drive work in the way I expect.

You can in deed use a FileHandle, but that requires InputStream along with the Google HTTP Client to do so.

This has absolutely nothing to do with the Windows registry.  It's about making a TCP request.

@Darkyenus tnx for the tip, I found a working solution using an Image. 
I actually had many problems with it

 - Net.HttpRequest [didn't work for me](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61447184/libgdx-net-httprequest-get-request-is-not-working) so I used okHttp for handling Desktop and Android
 - I had cross-origin issues with loading the image, solved it by calling to 
    ` image.getElement().setAttribute("crossOrigin", "anonymous");`

I ended up building a library for loading images on Android, Desktop, and Web(don't have an iOS to test it on). Can you please guide me on how I can submit a pool request for it?

This is a long-standing problem that comes up from time to time. In my opinion, we need a `Gdx.net.downloadImageToPixmap` helper method with two different implementations for GWT and all other backends. It is an easy task using code from GWT backend, but the needed classes and methods are not visible to the core.
Everyone is invited to submit PRs.

rename.from: HTML/GWT is crashing in compile, how to load an image from url?
rename.to: GWT not possible to download images into pixmap

issue.title: Dynamically loading GWT assets
issue.body:
### The Problem
Currently the way things are set up in the gwt-backend, all files are loaded upon starting the application. Once this is complete, no more files can be loaded due to the way GwtFileHandle is implemented.
The files available to load through the FileHandle constructor are tied to `com.badlogic.gdx.backends.gwt.preloader.Preloader` class which currently has no api for loading extra files once it has completed the initial load.

### Potential Solutions
- Expose a `loadAsset` method on the Preloader class which takes a link String and a callback function as arguments
- Add an overload to the `preload` method with an extra argument `String[] extraAssetLinks`


Personally, I would prefer the former, although it would require some refactoring to keep the `Preloader ` class DRY, the place where each asset is loaded individually could be extracted into its own function for example.

I am willing make this change myself, but I was wondering if it was more sensible to simply create a subclass of `Preloader` in my own project instead.
